snippet: Thousands of older wood and concrete apartment buildings vulnerable to collapse in a major earthquake would get costly upgrades under rules passed Friday by the Los Angeles City Council.
abstract: Los Angeles City Council passes rules requiring older wood and concrete buildings in city to undergo $5,000-per-unit upgrade to improve earthquake resistance; city leaders must determine how cost will be split among landlords and tenants.
lead_paragraph: Thousands of older wood and concrete apartment buildings vulnerable to collapse in a major earthquake would get costly upgrades under rules passed Friday by the Los Angeles City Council.

headline.main: California: Quake Retrofitting Ordered in Los Angeles
headline.print_headline: California: Quake Retrofitting Ordered in Los Angeles
